title: spack cannot show curl processor bar
body:
It's strange that , recent `spack` version cannot show download url and process bar.
I checked the code and found that `spack` don't print the log in fetch stage now.

And I dumped the `curl_args` by this way ,and found `'-#'` option enabled for `curl`, which means it should print the `process bar` when curl some package.
```
index fb8737389..5d3e64568 100644
--- a/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py
+++ b/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py
@@ -342,6 +342,8 @@ def _fetch_from_url(self, url):
         else:
             curl_args.append('-sS')  # just errors when not.

+        tty.msg(curl_args)
+
         connect_timeout = spack.config.get('config:connect_timeout', 10)

         if self.extra_options:
```

But the log I tested is that:
```
# spack install -v --keep-stage nicstat
==> Installing nicstat
==> ['-C', '-', '-o', '/tmp/root/spack-stage/build_cache/linux-centos8-aarch64-gcc-8.3.1-nicstat-1.95-wykopqo35367xqfw5lmlotytldtj7ygd.spec.yaml.part', '-f', '-D', '-', '-L', 'https://spack-llnl-mirror.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/build_cache/linux-centos8-aarch64-gcc-8.3.1-nicstat-1.95-wykopqo35367xqfw5lmlotytldtj7ygd.spec.yaml', '--stderr', '-', '-#']
==> No binary for nicstat found: installing from source
==> nicstat: Executing phase: 'edit'
==> [2020-08-12-19:57:01.463389] Copying Makefile.Linux to makefile
==> [2020-08-12-19:57:01.464149] FILTER FILE: makefile [replacing "CMODEL =\s+-m32"]
==> [2020-08-12-19:57:01.466012] FILTER FILE: makefile [replacing "sudo"]
==> nicstat: Executing phase: 'build'
==> [2020-08-12-19:57:01.469777] 'make' '-j8'
gcc -O3     nicstat.c   -o nicstat
mv nicstat `./nicstat.sh --bin-name`
==> nicstat: Executing phase: 'install'
==> [2020-08-12-19:57:02.797622] Installing . to /home/xiaojun/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-aarch64/gcc-8.3.1/nicstat-1.95-wykopqo35367xqfw5lmlotytldtj7ygd
[+] /home/xiaojun/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos8-aarch64/gcc-8.3.1/nicstat-1.95-wykopqo35367xqfw5lmlotytldtj7ygd
```

So, is that a bug or I missed something to enable curl log?
